sub_title: Data Consultant at Capgemini Insights & Data
summary:
Hi! My name is Susanna and I'm an IT Data Consultant at Cap. I love solving data puzzles, sudoku (the two might be related), content management, digital marketing and anticipating how a human brain thinks.

Industries I worked in: Hospitality, Real Estate, Food business, Retail, Public, Education (semi-public). 

Programmes I worked with: Microsoft Dynamics 365, OpenText, AppWorks, Salesforce, Pardot, Google Analytics, Shopify, Wordpress, Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Mailchimp.

Hobbies: learning languages (currently finding time to learn my 5th one!), travelling (31 and counting), baking, gardening and rebuilding my house (the last two ones I recently unlocked).

contributors.headline: Data Consultant at Capgemini Insights & Data

projects.title: Fundraising
projects.description: Organising various events in order to raise funds for Red Cross. During 3 months we managed to raise 450 euro, by promoting our actions on Facebook, LinkedIn, by selling furniture, by organising a FIFA tournament on the university premises and by placing a box in a Dutch supermarket in order to collect money from the plastic bottles. The money was raised with a purpose of support provision to those children who were separated from their families due to environmental disasters and other poor conditions.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Speaker at the NOS op 3 - Dutch broadcasting and media production company established by the youth and for the youth. Speaking about the situation of many international students, as well as my own, during the times of Covid-19 lockdown. 

Matters touched upon: prolongation of zoekjaar (orientation year) for the non-EU, financial difficulties, possible decrease of tuition fees for non-EU students in the times of the lockdown, international communities that stand up for a change in policies related to Covid-19.

Invitee and speaker at the 2019 European Migration Annual conference in the Hague "The Future of the Netherlands and Europe in the Battle for Talent". Invited to represent non-EU student community in the Netherlands as a third world country national. 

Matters discussed: overview of EU country policies, attraction, retention and challenges of the international students in the Netherlands and other EU member states.
Welcomed and guided freshmen of 89 different nationalities.
Liaised with organisers and teams to ensure the event was held successfully.

Lead a team of 20 students, organised team-building activities in Tbilisi, Georgia. These activities were essential in order to develop children's social skills and create a fun atmosphere, all with the purpose for them to overcome the English language barrier.
